pullRequest.body:
- Add the instances that fractional ideals of number fields are finite and free $\mathbb{Z}$-modules
- For `I : (FractionalIdeal (ùìû K)‚Å∞ K)À£` with `K` a number field, define a basis of `K` that spans `I` over $\mathbb{Z}$
- Prove that the determinant of that basis over an integral basis of `K` is the absolute norm of `I`

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

```suggestion
/-- A `‚Ñö`-basis of `K` that spans `I` over `‚Ñ§`, see mem_span_basisOfFractionalIdeal below.. -/
```

Can you modify a little bit the docstring using standard math terminology? I mean, this is the fact that the determinant of the base change matrix is the norm. It's also a good idea to add it right before the statement.
